alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:20AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing of poor drainage areas. Small rivers and stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM EDT, the public reported flooding of St. Mary`s Brook Road in Van Buren. There is also reports of flooding of the West Road in New Sweden and McClusky Brook on Little Madawaska Road in Westmanland. Heavy rainfall from last night is causing small stream and creek flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Van Buren, Woodland, Madawaska Lake, New Sweden, Grand Isle, Connor, Perham, Stockholm, Hamlin, Westmanland and Cyr Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
